709393f-a.text:
725-727 Sixth Avc., west side, south of, and adjoining the S.W. corner of west 24th Street, showing (No. 725) the Sixth Ave. "Playground". It is provided with a rifle range, many slot-machine games, and cheap recorded wusic, as a diversion for people with not too fine an appreciation of good entertainment. It is similar to many such places found in Coney Ialsnd.
December 24, 1936.
L. Sperr.

709396f-b.text:
Sixth Avenue, north from West 24th Street. showing a reclaimed thoroughfare. This has been brought about by the recent demolition of the old 'El' structure that formerly darkened this Avenue. In the left background appears the Greeley Square section with it's distinctive Hotel McAlpin. Dominoting the skyline is the towering
Empire State Building.
March 29, 1939
P. L. Sperr
(2)
The same area from a point slirhtly south of 24th Streot. Note the cleared site at the N.E. corner of same. This is being used by subway contractors as
a storage base and tunnel entrance.
October 28, 1939
P. L. Sperr
